title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic American novel about the Jazz Age and the American Dream.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarian government and surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel about manners, marriage, and society in Georgian England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age story about teenage rebellion and alienation.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: A multi-generational saga of the Buendia family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy adventure following hobbits on a quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological novel about guilt, redemption, and the nature of crime.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic science fiction adventure following Arthur Dent through space.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a genetically engineered future society.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel exploring faith, doubt, and morality through three brothers.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: An epic science fiction novel about politics, religion, and ecology on a desert planet.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Bronte
description: A Gothic romance following an orphaned governess and her mysterious employer.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Bronte
description: A tale of passionate and destructive love on the Yorkshire moors.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a young man whose portrait ages while he remains youthful.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of obsession as Captain Ahab hunts the white whale.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic novel of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic tale of love, family, and society in Imperial Russia.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: An existentialist novel about a detached man who commits a senseless murder.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novella about a man who wakes up transformed into a giant insect.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The adventures of a delusional knight and his faithful squire Sancho Panza.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic tale of a scientist who creates a living creature from dead matter.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The classic vampire novel told through letters, diaries, and newspaper clippings.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: An epic tale of betrayal, imprisonment, and elaborate revenge.

title: Les Miserables
author: Victor Hugo
description: An epic novel of justice, redemption, and revolution in 19th-century France.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novel about a family of tenant farmers displaced during the Great Depression.

title: Of Mice and Men
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novella about two displaced migrant ranch workers during the Great Depression.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: A satirical anti-war novel about a soldier who becomes unstuck in time.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel about the absurdity of war and bureaucracy.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian theocracy where women are subjugated.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A haunting novel about a former slave and the ghost of her dead daughter.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: An epistolary novel about an African American woman's struggles in the South.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A coming-of-age story of an orphan named Pip in Victorian England.

title: Oliver Twist
author: Charles Dickens
description: The story of an orphan boy's experiences in London's criminal underworld.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem following Odysseus's journey home from the Trojan War.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem set during the Trojan War.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem describing a journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: A nightmarish novel about a man arrested and prosecuted by a mysterious authority.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are outlawed and burned.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic landscape.

title: Blood Meridian
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A violent Western novel following a teenage runaway who joins a gang of scalp hunters.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
description: A groundbreaking cyberpunk novel about a washed-up computer hacker hired for a heist.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
description: A cyberpunk novel featuring a pizza delivery hacker and a dangerous computer virus.

title: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A science fiction novel about a group preserving knowledge during a galactic dark age.

title: I, Robot
author: Isaac Asimov
description: A collection of robot stories exploring the Three Laws of Robotics.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
author: Arthur C. Clarke
description: A science fiction novel about humanity's first contact with alien intelligence.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
description: A young genius is trained at a military academy in space to fight an alien war.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A science fiction novel exploring gender and society on a planet of androgynes.

title: A Wizard of Earthsea
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
description: A young wizard's journey of self-discovery in an archipelago world.
